DIALOGUE BEFORE: PrestonGarveyAlias: We're heading for that place Mama Murphy knows about: Sanctuary. It's not far.
RESPONSE TEXT: She knows about it? You mean she had one of her "visions" while she was stoned out of her gourd.
And now you want us to just head out on another wild goosechase based on no better plan than "Mama Murphy saw it"?
DIALOGUE AFTER: PrestonGarveyAlias: It can hardly turn out any worse than...

DIALOGUE BEFORE: SturgesAlias: Well, then. Sanctuary it is. Let's just hope it lives up to its name.
RESPONSE TEXT: Come on, Jun. It's time to go.
Are you insane?
SCRIPT NOTES: friend just shot you, but you're already on the floor panicking

RESPONSE TEXT: Can we leave now?
Garvey better get us out of here now that this is over with.
Some help the Minutemen were. If you hadn't shown up, we'd all be dead.
We need help, and we get a Vault Dweller? What are you going to do in that stupid jumpsuit? Bleed to death?
SCRIPT NOTES: player is wearing a vault suit

RESPONSE TEXT: What's going on? Are we getting out of here?
You're with the rescue team?
These are our lives you're playing with. Are you listening to me?
There are more of you. Right?
The Minutemen were supposed to protect us. Garvey promised. He promised.
We can't just stay trapped in here. This is ridiculous. Somebody do something.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: JunLong: Where are we going, Marcy?
RESPONSE TEXT: Don't worry, Jun. Just stay with me. It'll be fine.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Sturges: What do you think, Marcy?
RESPONSE TEXT: Well. It's better than Concord. Maybe we can at least rest for a while. Give Jun a chance to recover.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Preston: Let's find a place to settle in while we get the lay of the land.

RESPONSE TEXT: I can't believe we're going to Sanctuary just because Mama Murphy had a "vision".
SCRIPT NOTES: player just rescued you, and you're heading for Sanctuary / Disgust

RESPONSE TEXT: We better not be walking into another trap.
SCRIPT NOTES: player just rescued you, and you're heading for Sanctuary / Worried

RESPONSE TEXT: Sanctuary. We'll see about that. Hmph.
SCRIPT NOTES: player just rescued you, and you're heading for Sanctuary / Disgust

RESPONSE TEXT: Are you kidding me? What are we going to do without the Sight?
SCRIPT NOTES: Mama Murphy just died of chem overdose / Angry

RESPONSE TEXT: Everything always goes wrong. What are we even doing here?
SCRIPT NOTES: Mama Murphy just died of chem overdose / Angry

RESPONSE TEXT: Can't believe you and Preston let Mama Murphy die like that. You should've stopped her.
SCRIPT NOTES: Mama Murphy died of an overdose a day or so ago

RESPONSE TEXT: I'll hand it to you, this place isn't awful. It's still a hole, but it could be worse.
SCRIPT NOTES: She has difficulty being friendly / Friendly

RESPONSE TEXT: Life still ain't perfect, but we're surviving.
You call this place Sanctuary? Cemetery seems a little more appropriate...
Just when you think you're safe, you're not. That's how they always get ya.
Help out or get lost.
You want my two caps? We should keep moving. Don't want to be pinned down when the raiders come.
I'll stop complaining when there's nothing left to complain about.
You'd better keep your mouth shut about this place. Can't trust anyone.
SCRIPT NOTES: Threatening the player, then scared. / Worried

RESPONSE TEXT: Nothing I hate more than Raider scumbags. If you run into any, put a few down for me.
What?
Sure, let me just stop what I'm doing to talk to you... I'm being sarcastic, leave me alone.
Do I look like I want to chitchat?
What gave you the idea we're friends?
Hey Mama, how are you getting along?
DIALOGUE AFTER: MamaMurphy: Just fine. It's nice to finally settle down after spending so much time moving around.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: MamaMurphy: Just fine. It's nice to finally settle down after spending so much time moving around.
RESPONSE TEXT: Oh yeah? You spent a little time on the run when you were younger?
DIALOGUE AFTER: MamaMurphy: Oh yes, you have to when there's a bounty on your head. A little elderly advice, don't double cross a raider. They hold long grudges.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: MamaMurphy: Oh yes, you have to when there's a bounty on your head. A little elderly advice, don't double cross a raider. They hold long grudges.
RESPONSE TEXT: Yeah, that's good advice...Sounds like quite the adventure.
DIALOGUE AFTER: MamaMurphy: It was. Some day I'll tell you all about it.

RESPONSE TEXT: Oh sorry...
DIALOGUE AFTER: JunLong: Do you want to talk about it?

RESPONSE TEXT: No, I'm fine. I just...I don't want to think about it anymore.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: JunLong: It's okay. I still think about him too.
RESPONSE TEXT: I said I'm fine. Leave me alone Jun.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: JunLong: Oh...well maybe I can help.
RESPONSE TEXT: No, you won't do it right. I have to do it myself.
